page.title: 10BOARHILLS PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: This country school is situated in the centre of the village and educates 10 children of which 8 come from Boarhills and 2 are from St.Andrews. The school role has drastically decreased in numbers over the past 50 years .In 1936 there were 60 pupils. The school has two teachers -one full-time and the other part-time. The school itself is well equipped with a computer, video recorder and numerous items of gym equipment. They have a small music department comprising a piano, xylophone and various percussion instruments. The majority of the pupils bring packed lunches but the local authority will provide a cooked lunch if desired.
